title: Fair Play
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2DsFPqz

by leoba

Finn runs into an old acquaintance, Rey meets somebody new, and Ben has a conversation with someone he should have reached out to a long time ago.

Words: 8284, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 16 of Finnreylo Murder AU

  • Fandoms: Star Wars Sequel Trilogy
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Gen, Multi
  • Characters: Ben Solo | Kylo Ren, Ben Solo, Finn (Star Wars), Rey (Star Wars), Poe Dameron, Han Solo, Leia Organa
  • Relationships: Finn/Kylo Ren/Rey, Finn & Kylo Ren & Rey, Finn & Rey & Ben Solo | Kylo Ren, Finn/Rey/Ben Solo | Kylo Ren, Finn/Rey/Ben Solo
  • Additional Tags: Discussions of childhood gaslighting, snoke did a real number on young Ben solo, Historical Reenactment, at the county fair, Selective Memory, sex as therapy is maybe not the most healthy thing, BDSM mention, murder mention, past stormpilot

blog.name: swpromptsandasks
blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

tags: they haven't left the planet yet
Obi-Wan did get covered in zombie mucus last chapter you know
summary: What happens next in Undead Walking? Do they get out alright, lose anyone (please no)? Do the Jedi at the Temple comprehend the...
question: What happens next in Undead Walking? Do they get out alright, lose anyone (please no)? Do the Jedi at the Temple comprehend the sheer level of visceral TERROR being near dead things that want to eat you is like? Is the whole planet quarantined?
answer:
Opening his eyes when he felt a gentle thumb rub his forehead, Obi-Wan smiled meekly up at Anakin as the blond knelt beside him. “Hey.” He rasped out, licking his dry lips.

“Hey, didn’t mean to wake you,” Anakin smiled down at him. “Was just coming to check on you and make sure you were okay.” He confessed quietly.

Humming quietly as the thumb continued slowly rubbing, Obi-Wan breathed out steadily. “I was awake before you came over if I’m honest, I’m just pretty drugged up thanks to Helix and Kix.” He chuckled quietly.

That got a small smile out of Anakin. “I’d ask how the arm is feeling but considering that admission I’m imagining you don’t feel much of it.”

Both looked to Obi-Wan’s bound up arm, Helix having made splinters and bandaged it properly up until they could get to the bone knitter on the Negotiator once they were sure Obi-Wan was clean after his encounter with the zombie.

Regardless, the zombie had broken the arm with the ferocious bite.

“It throbs.” Obi-Wan finally murmured, blinking slowly.

Anakin rested his mech hand on the bandages and then sighed. “Its times like this I regret I don’t have a good hand for healing,” He grimaced deeply. “It would be so useful, not just for you but for Ahsoka too.” Anakin said bitterly, his face twisting.

Jerking a bit, Obi-Wan tried to sit up only for Anakin to place his hand his former master’s shoulder to keep him down. “Ahsoka? What happened?” Obi-Wan asked, trying to keep the panic out of his voice.

Grunting a bit, Anakin squeezed his shoulder. “Easy, easy Obi-Wan, I phrased that wrong. She went through a ruined staircase step while she was salvaging with the troopers, Snips just sprained her leg and is sitting and sulking cause she can’t do much, orders of Kix.” He explained quickly, breathing out when Obi-Wan relaxed. “Honestly, we set together this bedding area for a reason Obi-Wan, you need to rest. You’ve been throwing up from the Force being so twisted several times already and now you’re injured. Its not good for you.” Anakin said seriously.

Rubbing his face with his good hand, Obi-Wan let out a little mumble. “I know, I’m sorry Anakin, I just… assumed the worst.” He breathed out heavily and turned his eyes to the ceiling of the cleared out warehouse they had made their base, the second floor free of any infected ‘life’.

The closeness to supplies and the lack of infected ‘life’ had made it an ideal place to station themselves, especially as they also had the roof for vantage to scout with it also being easy to land the transport ships on a nearby landing pad on the other roofs.

The troopers ingenuity had also made it an easy walk between them as they had rigged makeshift bridges out of material laying around though Obi-Wan had not seen them as he had been resigned to the little sick area with Waxer and Jesse when a locker of all things had come loose and landed on them.

They weren’t too badly injured, sprains, but they needed rest though Obi-Wan had a strong suspicion that they were also going to keep an eye on the Jedi patient that was strongly sedated.

Jerking to a bit in surprise when fingers gently brushed through his hair, Obi-Wan turned his eyes back to Anakin as he was broken from his pensive mood, meeting the others serious blue eyes. “Its going to be alright Obi-Wan. I know you’re worried and injured, I know you’re sick to your stomach and so am I and Ahsoka which makes us compromised since the wrongness in the Force is literally ruining us but we got the troopers who are as clear in the head as always and they never disappoint.” He smiled a bit.

Letting out a soft noise, Obi-Wan chuckled. “Putting our trust in them has never failed us.” He agreed quietly, knowing that Helix and a small team of troopers were back to the blood check station they had been at with a fresh sample of Obi-Wan’s blood.

Hopefully…

Regardless, Obi-Wan put his trust in their troopers.

They weren’t too badly injured, sprains, but they needed rest though Obi-Wan had a strong suspicion that they were also going to keep an eye on the Jedi patient that was strongly sedated.

Jerking to a bit in surprise when fingers gently brushed through his hair, Obi-Wan turned his eyes back to Anakin as he was broken from his pensive mood, meeting the others serious blue eyes. “Its going to be alright Obi-Wan. I know you’re worried and injured, I know you’re sick to your stomach and so am I and Ahsoka which makes us compromised since the wrongness in the Force is literally ruining us but we got the troopers who are as clear in the head as always and they never disappoint.” He smiled a bit.

Letting out a soft noise, Obi-Wan chuckled. “Putting our trust in them has never failed us.” He agreed quietly, knowing that Helix and a small team of troopers were back to the blood check station they had been at with a fresh sample of Obi-Wan’s blood.

Hopefully…

Regardless, Obi-Wan put his trust in their troopers.

trail.content_raw:
Opening his eyes when he felt a gentle thumb rub his forehead, Obi-Wan smiled meekly up at Anakin as the blond knelt beside him. “Hey.” He rasped out, licking his dry lips.

“Hey, didn’t mean to wake you,” Anakin smiled down at him. “Was just coming to check on you and make sure you were okay.” He confessed quietly.

Humming quietly as the thumb continued slowly rubbing, Obi-Wan breathed out steadily. “I was awake before you came over if I’m honest, I’m just pretty drugged up thanks to Helix and Kix.” He chuckled quietly.

That got a small smile out of Anakin. “I’d ask how the arm is feeling but considering that admission I’m imagining you don’t feel much of it.”

Both looked to Obi-Wan’s bound up arm, Helix having made splinters and bandaged it properly up until they could get to the bone knitter on the Negotiator once they were sure Obi-Wan was clean after his encounter with the zombie.

Regardless, the zombie had broken the arm with the ferocious bite.

“It throbs.” Obi-Wan finally murmured, blinking slowly.

Anakin rested his mech hand on the bandages and then sighed. “Its times like this I regret I don’t have a good hand for healing,” He grimaced deeply. “It would be so useful, not just for you but for Ahsoka too.” Anakin said bitterly, his face twisting.

Jerking a bit, Obi-Wan tried to sit up only for Anakin to place his hand his former master’s shoulder to keep him down. “Ahsoka? What happened?” Obi-Wan asked, trying to keep the panic out of his voice.

Grunting a bit, Anakin squeezed his shoulder. “Easy, easy Obi-Wan, I phrased that wrong. She went through a ruined staircase step while she was salvaging with the troopers, Snips just sprained her leg and is sitting and sulking cause she can’t do much, orders of Kix.” He explained quickly, breathing out when Obi-Wan relaxed. “Honestly, we set together this bedding area for a reason Obi-Wan, you need to rest. You’ve been throwing up from the Force being so twisted several times already and now you’re injured. Its not good for you.” Anakin said seriously.

Rubbing his face with his good hand, Obi-Wan let out a little mumble. “I know, I’m sorry Anakin, I just… assumed the worst.” He breathed out heavily and turned his eyes to the ceiling of the cleared out warehouse they had made their base, the second floor free of any infected ‘life’.

The closeness to supplies and the lack of infected ‘life’ had made it an ideal place to station themselves, especially as they also had the roof for vantage to scout with it also being easy to land the transport ships on a nearby landing pad on the other roofs.

The troopers ingenuity had also made it an easy walk between them as they had rigged makeshift bridges out of material laying around though Obi-Wan had not seen them as he had been resigned to the little sick area with Waxer and Jesse when a locker of all things had come loose and landed on them.

They weren’t too badly injured, sprains, but they needed rest though Obi-Wan had a strong suspicion that they were also going to keep an eye on the Jedi patient that was strongly sedated.

Jerking to a bit in surprise when fingers gently brushed through his hair, Obi-Wan turned his eyes back to Anakin as he was broken from his pensive mood, meeting the others serious blue eyes. “Its going to be alright Obi-Wan. I know you’re worried and injured, I know you’re sick to your stomach and so am I and Ahsoka which makes us compromised since the wrongness in the Force is literally ruining us but we got the troopers who are as clear in the head as always and they never disappoint.” He smiled a bit.

Letting out a soft noise, Obi-Wan chuckled. “Putting our trust in them has never failed us.” He agreed quietly, knowing that Helix and a small team of troopers were back to the blood check station they had been at with a fresh sample of Obi-Wan’s blood.

Hopefully…

Regardless, Obi-Wan put his trust in their troopers.

blog.name: swpromptsandasks
blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

tags: I have no idea what to put in these tags
its just Anakin and Obi talking
summary: For Freedomintruth, maybe more of Obi-Wan being supported by the clones? Or Anakin digging more into Palpatine's reasons for...
question: For Freedomintruth, maybe more of Obi-Wan being supported by the clones? Or Anakin digging more into Palpatine's reasons for knowing an old Sith legend?
answer:
When the other had come home quiet and thoughtful, Obi-Wan hadn’t really put much notice in it since Obi-Wan was recently returned and Anakin tended to let him have some peace before he started to chatter but when the silence persisted he had to admit that he was getting a bit nervous for his friend. But before he could ask the other if something was wrong, Anakin spoke up as he stood at the kitchenette bench with the kettles. “The Chancellor told me a peculiar story today, when he took me to the ballet.” Anakin’s voice was light but there was something in his tone…

“Oh?” Obi-Wan settled against the arm of the couch, watching the blond. “Though now I have to ask if you enjoyed the Mon Calamari ballet since you were there.” He smiled softly.

A considering hum filled the air before Anakin shrugged. “I have to admit it was pretty but I’m not quite sure it was my thing.” He lifted the cups off the bench and headed over to Obi-Wan, offering one cup to him which was gratefully accepted.

“Well, not shocking, you’re more one for speedy, exciting things. But back to this strange story you were told?” Obi-Wan blew on the tea as Anakin settled with his own cup of caff.

However it took several moments before Anakin spoke again, settling a deep root of concern in Obi-Wan.

What in the galaxy had the Chancellor told Anakin that could cause him to be this disturbed?

Finally Anakin huffed out a deep breath and looked at Obi-Wan seriously. “Have you ever heard of Darth Plagueis the wise?” He asked, a deep frown on his face that scrunched up his brows.

“Who?” Obi-Wan blinked, looking at his old padawan in surprise as the other took a sip of his own cup.

After Qui-Gon’s death, Obi-Wan had maybe gotten a bit obsessed with the old Sith lore the temple had and had read what they had on each of them but he had to admit he had never heard of this Darth Plagueis.

His question got a quick glance from Anakin. “You don’t know him?” He questioned in return, lips pursed to go along with his bunched brows.

Shaking his head slowly, Obi-Wan blinked. “No, I have never heard that name before anywhere but I mean, I am a Jedi and much history has been lost.” He murmured with puzzlement.

“Maybe but I got the feeling from the Chancellor that he was a fairly recent thing, a Sith that could save others from death but not himself.” Anakin said quietly with his hands tight on the blue cup in his hand.

Bewildered, Obi-Wan took a fresh sip of tea just to gather his thoughts. “So you’re telling me that the Chancellor told you a Sith legend?” Obi-Wan blinked hard before shaking his head. “Hang on, how does he even know a Sith legend? A recent one from a Sith we have no knowledge o-” He went mute.

Anakin was staring at him, his hand white on the mug with the mech one fisted on his lap.

Obi-Wan’s brain was working a mile a parasec.

“…Its not just me then?” Anakin swallowed heavily. “Its suspicious?” He whispered, a mix between horrified and hopeful.

Slowly shaking his head, Obi-Wan licked his lips. “I… its a serious accusation here in the temple even if others don’t have a reference for Sith in our age and time. To them he would just be another section of the a Force religion if what we suspect is true, no worse to them than the Guardians of the Whills or Jedha’s temple.” He whispered in return, trying to ease his grip on his own cup.

“But,” Anakin stressed, his shoulders shaking a bit. “Its not just me? You see it too right?” He questioned with some desperation. “Its suspicious?”

When Obi-Wan nodded slowly, Anakin let out a relieved little whimper and almost deflated from the sight of it. “Its not just you.”

“Oh thank all little goddesses.” Anakin took a large sip of caff though he looked up in surprise when Obi-Wan set down his cup on the caff table and stood.

Peering back, Obi-Wan gave a weak smile. “We need to speak to the council, because honestly Anakin, I have no idea what to do now.” He chuckled nervously and to his relief, Anakin nodded in agreement and stood. ‘Right now I don’t think I can be anything but grateful for that truth serum incident. I’m not sure he would have listened to me if it hadn’t happened.’ Obi-Wan rested his hand on the others shoulder, grateful Anakin had come to him.

summary: 'Star Wars Perspectives' #4 by Andy Fairhurst, a new officially licensed print release by Bottleneck Gallery, in collaboration...
caption:
‘Star Wars Perspectives’ #4 by Andy Fairhurst, a new officially licensed print release by Bottleneck Gallery, in collaboration with Lucasfilm & Acme Archives.

13" x 19" giclée prints, in numbered limited editions of 300 for $45 each or $125 for the set of three prints.

On sale Thursday November 8 at 12pm ET from the Bottleneck Gallery website.

title: a galaxy far far away
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2yZB4RL

by biguglyjacketthateveryonehates

Kylo Ren is a world famous author, having gained worldwide acclaim for his book ‘Star Wars: A New Hope’. The only issue, he didn’t write it.

Words: 4131, Chapters: 3/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars - All Media Types, Star Trek: The Original Series, The Force Awakens - Fandom
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Rey (Star Wars), Kylo Ren, Ben Solo, Leia Organa, Han Solo, Poe Dameron, Finn (Star Wars), Snoke (Star Wars), Armitage Hux, Phasma (Star Wars)
  • Relationships: Kylo Ren/Rey, Rey & Ben Solo | Kylo Ren, Rey/Ben Solo, Finn/Rey, Poe Dameron/Finn
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe, Angst, Slow Burn, Kylo Ren is an asshole, Rey is very small and very angry, AU, Eventual Smut, WriterAU, authorau, Alternate Universe - Modern Setting


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2yZB4RL
